title: Thoughts on Malzahar
body:
We've had a bit of time since his nerfs and I wanted to point something out. First off, he's at a 55% win rate. You can check [here at op.gg](https://na.op.gg/champion/malzahar/statistics/mid) and [here at champion.gg](http://champion.gg/champion/Malzahar/Middle?league=). Its pretty obvious that he's still very overtuned. However, I wanted to address a problem we saw after his rework thats happening again.

His passive is eating up too much of his power budget.

We saw this after his rework. His passive being so strong and limiting potential counterplay is going to lead to the rest of Malz's kit getting trashed again.

If we want Malz to stay an AP carry Midlaner, the passive has to go. I know a lot of people dont want this, but we've  been here before and its going to happen again. His damage is going to get nerfed over and over again to balance out the rest of his kit. This is going to force him out of the mid lane role again.

Malz is going to have to give up either damage or utility. I think giving up the utility of his passive is the best route to continue being a Midlaner. You don't have to like it, but you Malz players have already lived through the alternative. I think this is the best way to save him from Bot Lane.

***tl;dr*** Instead of nerfing Malz's damage again, please consider doing something with his passive so his MIdlane viability isn't destroyed

@thread
If malzahars passive shield is removed then he needs his base stat nerfs reverted. Theres no reason for an immobile mage with one AoE burst ability to have such low MS and attack range if he isnt _very_ safe.

Ill also reiterate something ive said since the beginning; Make malzahars passive a spell blade that scales with AP/level and makes his voidlings target whoever he hits if malefic visions is down.
Alternately, the idea of making his passive something that buffs stats based on level would be interesting... Voidlings getting better over the course of the game, base MS increasing over the course of the game. Perhaps even a magic shield that scales with AP like a malphite passive would be interesting too.
Voidlings not dying to _one fucking auto_ would be incredibly, incredibly nice...
Voidlings not being an enforced way to reduce Malz's reliable damage could be _fantastic_.

I have a couple problems with current malzahar.

1) the voidlings spawn on top of you, meaning they take just forever to actually walk up and hit something. I really dislike this. This means malz is inherently MUCH better at kiting than chasing. It's really irritating due to point number 2.

2) the voidlings have such low HP pools that at all stages of the game, they die from anything instantly.  I'm fine with autoattacks or turret shots killing them instantly, but currently any aoe ability or incident aoe from any teamfighting kills the voidlings instantly. Even a Janna tornado kills them instantly. Why even give them HP pools at this point? Even if you max them first, they die in one shot from any ability. Even at the final stages of the game. At all stages of the game they fall over from anything at all. Just make them instantly die if anything touches them. That is how they work basically right now. So you're not really getting anything out of the voidlings EXCEPT if you're kiting AND you have rylai's. They spawn, they start walking up, they usually die before hitting anything.

This means malz is absolutely pigeonholed into building rylai's every game. Even then, the voidlings are pretty junk. It's not that there is counterplay, it's that the voidlings get accidentally deleted no matter what during a teamfight. Theyre really just pretty useless right now. And it doesn't matter if you summon 1,2, or 3. They're dead usually before they AA anything.

I'd much rather see them be a useful and interactive part of the kit. As it stands right now, all your damage comes from Q (poke and cc during teamfights) and R. Your E does damage, but its over time and its just not as effective as most midlaners core spells should be. It's ok, it slows, it's fluff. IDK you're not gonna kill anyone but a low HP squishy with it.

TBH I'd love for the voidlings to be a core part of the damage, and the ult (suppress) be a cc for your voidlings and E to do the work. They were headed in the right direction. Where they are right now is relying on Q, R, and to a lesser extent E. You're only maxing E in lane for efficient waveclear and pressure/shove.

His shield should be replaced.  It would really make sense if the voidlings were the passive instead of an ability, because they feel really clunky to use right now.  This way we could give him another ability.

How about we move the R pool to his W, buff R flat dmg and ratio?
